title: WHY CAN YOU SEE ENEMEIES MOST PLAYED CHAMPS IN CLASH????
body: WHO THOUGHT THIS WAS A GOOD IDEA? THERE ARE JUST GOING TO BAN OUR MOST PLAYED CHAMPIONS AND JUST END UP LOSING.

replies.body:
One of *the* key skills in League is adaptability. Also, knowing your enemy is a big part of pro tournaments, which is ultimately the experience that Clash is trying to deliver to the lay-player.

If you just want to play teams without the tournament element, that's what flex queue is for.

If you've ever watched pro-play, you'll see target banning is a big part of it.

Clash plays by similar rules to Pro-Play, Seeing enemy champs means you can understand and adapt to their playstyle, if the enemy mid has 22 games on Zed while the adc only has 6 games on Kai-Sa, who are you more likely to ban

Adaptability is key to league, in low elo not so much, in plat+ yeah, big part of it

This is why OTPing a champ is bad, and you should know a minimum of 5 champs per role (or ones that you can flex pick between those roles)

If you OTP a champ, you don't deserve to win lmao, because it means you're only good at one thing
